Situation1: They share only one open evening before a busy travel week.
Expectation2: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation2: A first-time visitor looks disappointed with the colour tone in the mirror.
Story: Tonight was supposed to be special. My boyfriend and I had circled this evening on our calendars weeks ago, knowing it was our only chance to be together before he left for his business trip. I’d promised him a quiet dinner, just us, no distractions. But as I was finishing up my last client at the salon, a first-time visitor frowned at her reflection, her voice trembling as she said the colour wasn’t what she’d hoped for. My heart sank. As a hairdresser, I knew I couldn’t let her leave unhappy; my reputation and her trust were on the line. But every minute I spent fixing her hair was a minute stolen from the precious time I’d promised my boyfriend. I could feel my phone buzzing in my pocket—his name lighting up the screen. My chest tightened as I glanced between the disappointed client and the clock, torn between the woman in my chair and the man waiting for me.
